【FakeNews】美国商务部将与华为相关45家新企业列入出口黑名单 http://tva1.sinaimg.cn/large/0060lm7Tly1g65get9lgdj30u01dgqbz.jpg
微软提供中文翻译
华盛顿（CNN商业）美国商务部周一表示，将与中国技术巨头华为（Huawei）相关的45家新业务列入出口黑名单。
与此同时，商务部表示，正在更新一个临时通用许可证，允许美国公司有限度地与华为开展业务，例如向华为设备提供安全更新。续约期为90天，于周一生效。
华为是特朗普与中国更广泛的贸易战的支点。周日，特朗普在推特上说，在经济顾问拉里•库德洛（Larry Kudlow）似乎表明达成协议取得进展之后，美国"与中国合作得很好，而且正在交谈"。
与此同时，在周一的福克斯商业节目中，美国商务部长威尔伯·罗斯（Wilbur Ross）声称，中国供应商已经承受了特朗普对中国制造商品的关税的"全部或部分打击"。
在宣布实体名单移动的一份声明中，Ross说，延长临时一般许可证反映了"需要更多的时间来防止任何中断"。
长期以来，美国一直认为华为构成国家安全威胁，并声称北京可以利用华为产品对其他国家进行间谍活动。这一说法促使美国政府敦促其盟友限制或禁止在5G网络中使用华为设备，这将损害华为成为下一代无线技术全球领导者的努力。华为否认其任何产品构成国家安全风险。
今年5月，美国政府将华为列入贸易黑名单，禁止美国公司在没有许可证的情况下销售华为软件和组件，这加剧了与华为的争斗。
这些限制给公司与其合作伙伴（包括谷歌和销售智能手机的移动运营商）的关系带来了不确定性。华为智能手机在谷歌Android操作系统上运行，并附带了谷歌地图和Gmail等热门应用。如果没有谷歌服务，华为设备对中国以外的用户的吸引力就小了很多。
IDC的研究人员表示，上季度，全球销量约占华为智能手机出货量的三分之一。2018年，在禁令实施前，华为将近一半的智能手机销往中国以外地区。该公司还面临着来自三星和竞争对手中国公司的激烈竞争。
华为正试图保护其智能手机业务，以防未来无法与谷歌合作。本月早些时候，该公司宣布自己的操作系统，名为"和谐"，理论上可以用来取代谷歌Android在华为智能手机和其他设备。该公司挑战该平台将让开发人员为其构建应用程序。
Washington, DC(CNN Business) The US Commerce Department said Monday it is adding more than 45 new businesses associated with Huawei, the embattled Chinese technology giant, to an export blacklist.
At the same time, Commerce said it was renewing a temporary general license that permits companies in the United States to do business with Huawei on a limited basis, such as to provide security updates to Huawei devices. The renewal lasts for 90 days and went into effect on Monday.
Huawei is a fulcrum in Trump's wider trade war with China. On Sunday, Trump tweeted that the United States is "doing very well with China, and talking!" after economic adviser Larry Kudlow appeared to indicate progress toward a deal.
Meanwhile, on Fox Business on Monday, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross claimed that Chinese vendors have borne "all or part of the hit" from Trump's tariffs on Chinese-made goods.
In a statement announcing the entity list move, Ross said the extension of the temporary general license reflects that "more time is necessary to prevent any disruption."
The United States has long argued that Huawei poses a national security threat, and has claimed Beijing can use the company's products to spy on other nations. That claim has driven the US government to urge its allies to restrict or ban the use of Huawei equipment in their 5G networks — efforts that would hurt Huawei's efforts to become the global leader of the next generation of wireless technology. Huawei denies that any of its products pose a national security risk.
Washington escalated its battle with Huawei in May when it placed the company on a trade blacklist, barring American companies from selling the company software and components without a license.
Those restrictions created uncertainties for the company's relationships with its partners, including Google and mobile operators that sell its smartphones. Huawei smartphones run on Google's Android operating system and come with popular apps like Google Maps and Gmail. Without access to Google services, Huawei's devices become a lot less attractive to users outside of China.
Last quarter, global sales accounted for about one third of Huawei's smartphone shipments, according to researchers at IDC. In 2018, before the ban, Huawei sold nearly half of its smartphones outside of China. The company also faces fierce competition from Samsung and rival Chinese companies.
Huawei is trying to protect its smartphone business in case it can't work with Google in the future. Earlier this month, the company announced its own operating system, called Harmony, which can in theory be used to replace Google's Android in Huawei smartphones and other devices. The company's challenge with that platform will be getting developers to build apps for it.
FakeNews
